info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 12:29PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of East Arkansas, including the following areas, Clay and Greene. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 PM CST, the public reported street flooding in Piggott due to heavy rainfall. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Eastern Clay County and central Greene County are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paragould, Piggott, Rector, Marmaduke, Crowleys Ridge State Park, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Lake Frierson State Park, Oak Grove Heights, Lafe, St. Francis, Pollard, Greenway, Beech Grove, Walcott, Saint Francis, Crockett, Knob, Heubner, Halliday and Fritz. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
